location: Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

lines.text: Alarums. Enter RUTLAND and his Tutor

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: Ah, whither shall I fly to scape their hands Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!
Enter CLIFFORD and Soldiers

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life. As for the brat of this accursed duke, Whose father slew my father, he shall die.

lines.speaker: tutor
lines.text: And I, my lord, will bear him company.

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Soldiers, away with him!

lines.speaker: tutor
lines.text: Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child, Lest thou be hated both of God and man!
Exit, dragged off by Soldiers

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: How now! is he dead already or is it fear That makes him close his eyes Ill open them.

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: So looks the pentup lion oer the wretch That trembles under his devouring paws And so he walks, insulting oer his prey, And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder. Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword, And not with such a cruel threatening look. Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die. I am too mean a subject for thy wrath: Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: In vain thou speakst, poor boy my fathers blood Hath stoppd the passage where thy words should enter.

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: Then let my fathers blood open it again: He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine Were not revenge sufficient for me No, if I diggd up thy forefathers graves And hung their rotten coffins up in chains, It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart. The sight of any of the house of York Is as a fury to torment my soul And till I root out their accursed line And leave not one alive, I live in hell. Therefore
Lifting his hand

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: O, let me pray before I take my death! To thee I pray sweet Clifford, pity me!

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Such pity as my rapiers point affords.

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Thy father hath.

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: But twas ere I was born. Thou hast one son for his sake pity me, Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just, He be as miserably slain as I. Ah, let me live in prison all my days And when I give occasion of offence, Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: No cause! Thy father slew my father therefore, die.
Stabs him

lines.speaker: rutland
lines.text: Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!
Dies

lines.speaker: clifford
lines.text: Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet! And this thy sons blood cleaving to my blade Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood, Congeald with this, do make me wipe off both.
Exit
